decision_cards.summary: Dual fused GF256 kernels with deterministic policy gating (`DualKernelPolicy`).

expected_value.hypothesis: Substantial throughput gains in selected size/ISA regimes with bounded downside under policy gating.
measured_highlights: mul_slices2 n=4096: fused ~29.42 vs seq ~25.35 GiB/s
mul_slices2 n=16384: fused ~25.89 vs seq ~36.17 GiB/s (regression)
addmul_slices2 n=16384: fused ~26.04 vs seq ~27.72 GiB/s (regression)

proof_safety_constraints: Bit-exact equivalence against conservative sequential kernels.
Policy selection must remain deterministic for identical inputs/config.
Scalar fallback remains mandatory and selectable.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Use deterministic policy windows/ratio thresholds and disable fused path where regressions appear.

evidence_refs: asupersync-348uw bead notes (2026-02-14 through 2026-02-15 benchmark corpus)

fallback_plan.trigger: Any sustained p95 regression versus sequential comparator in target regime.
fallback_plan.action: Set policy to non-fused path and keep superkernel code gated.

rollback_rehearsal.command: rch exec -- env ASUPERSYNC_GF256_DUAL_POLICY=never CARGO_TARGET_DIR=/tmp/rch-bench-g3-e4 cargo bench --bench raptorq_benchmark -- gf256_primitives --sample-size 10 --warm-up-time 0.1 --measurement-time 0.1
post_rollback_verification_checklist: Benchmark output present under target dir and parseable.
No fused-path activation in logs/config snapshot.
Targeted tests pass: `rch exec -- cargo test -p asupersync --lib raptorq::gf256 -- --nocapture`.

unit: rch exec -- cargo test -p asupersync --lib raptorq::gf256 -- --nocapture
rch exec -- cargo test -p asupersync --lib raptorq::linalg -- --nocapture

deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- env ASUPERSYNC_GF256_DUAL_POLICY=auto CARGO_TARGET_DIR=/tmp/rch-bench-g3-e4-post cargo bench --bench raptorq_benchmark -- gf256_primitives --sample-size 10 --warm-up-time 0.1 --measurement-time 0.1

decision_cards.summary: Deterministic GF256 architecture profile-pack selection and runtime dispatch metadata.

expected_value.hypothesis: Architecture-specific profile packs improve decode throughput while preserving deterministic fallback behavior.
measured_highlights: Track-E prior scalar/fused corpus indicates substantial gains in selected regimes (e.g. dual fused uplift in representative cases).
2026-02-19 E5 slices landed deterministic profile catalog + host-class rejected-candidate metadata + replay pointer surfacing.
2026-02-19 third E5 slice added deterministic tuning-candidate provenance fields and structured benchmark log metadata (tuning corpus ID, selected/rejected candidate IDs, command bundle).
2026-02-20 fourth E5 slice added deterministic profile-pack manifest snapshot API and manifest-level reproducibility fields in Track-E benchmark logs.
2026-02-20 fifth E5 slice added deterministic environment metadata (arch/os/env/endian/pointer width) to manifest snapshots and Track-E policy logs.
2026-02-20 sixth E5 slice added artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_bench_v1.json with baseline/auto/rollback comparator capture and rollback rehearsal outcomes.
2026-02-20 seventh E5 slice added directional p95/p99 comparator corpus artifact (artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_v1.json) from Track-E baseline/auto/rollback captures.
2026-02-20 eighth E5 slice started high-confidence p95/p99 corpus generation targeting artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_highconf_v1.json (coord thread msg #1487).
2026-02-20 ninth E5 status update: high-confidence reruns hit transient unrelated retry.rs compile-frontier breakage; remediation is active (coord msgs #1493/#1504).
Final offline tuner and p95/p99 comparator corpus remains in progress under asupersync-36m6p.

proof_safety_constraints: Profile selection must be deterministic for identical host features and requested profile.
Unknown/unsupported profile requests must fail closed to scalar conservative fallback with explicit reason.
Bit-exactness against conservative scalar path must be preserved.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Adopt deterministic profile pack metadata and dispatch first; enable broader profile-tuned selection only with measured comparator evidence.

evidence_refs: asupersync-36m6p comments #1848/#1855 (manifest snapshot and environment reproducibility metadata; all-targets checks pass)
agent-mail thread asupersync-3ltrv msg #1383 (2026-02-19 E5 evidence sync)
agent-mail thread coord-2026-02-19 msgs #1408/#1410 (compile-mismatch no longer reproduced)
agent-mail thread asupersync-3ltrv msgs #1422/#1424 (E5 fifth-slice evidence + corrected anchor)
agent-mail thread asupersync-3ltrv msg #1441 and coord thread msg #1443 (sixth-slice comparator artifact + rollback capture confirmation)
agent-mail thread asupersync-3ltrv msgs #1461/#1465 (seventh-slice p95/p99 artifact + corrected anchor)
agent-mail thread coord-2026-02-19 msg #1487 (high-confidence p95/p99 corpus run started; pending artifact publication)
agent-mail thread coord-2026-02-19 msgs #1493/#1504 (transient retry.rs compile-frontier blockage and active remediation while high-confidence run proceeds)

fallback_plan.trigger: Unsupported host/profile combination, profile-pack validation mismatch, or comparator regression in selected profile.
fallback_plan.action: Pin profile selection to scalar-conservative-v1 and disable aggressive dual-policy routing.
fallback_plan.conservative_mode: Scalar conservative profile-pack with deterministic fallback reasons.

rollback_rehearsal.command: rch exec -- env ASUPERSYNC_GF256_PROFILE_PACK=scalar-conservative-v1 ASUPERSYNC_GF256_DUAL_POLICY=never CARGO_TARGET_DIR=/tmp/rch-bench-g3-e5-rollback cargo bench --bench raptorq_benchmark -- gf256_primitives --sample-size 10 --warm-up-time 0.1 --measurement-time 0.1
post_rollback_verification_checklist: Bench logs show profile_pack=scalar-conservative-v1 (or explicit fallback to it).
Targeted metadata tests pass (`profile_pack_catalog_*`, `profile_pack_selection_*`, `dual_policy_snapshot_*`).
Deterministic E2E fast bundle still passes.

structured_logs: benches/raptorq_benchmark.rs Track-E policy/probe logs emit manifest-level reproducibility fields.

notes: Profile-pack and tuning-candidate provenance fields are now emitted in Track-E policy logs.
Manifest snapshot metadata (schema/version/catalog counts/selected candidate details) is now emitted and covered by deterministic tests.
Environment reproducibility metadata (target_arch/target_os/target_env/target_endian/target_pointer_width_bits) is now included in manifest snapshots and emitted in policy logs.
Directional p95/p99 summaries are now attached via artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_v1.json.
High-confidence p95/p99 corpus run is started (coord msg #1487) and targets artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_highconf_v1.json for closure-grade evidence.
High-confidence reruns currently depend on clearing transient unrelated retry.rs compile-frontier errors reported in coord msgs #1493/#1504.
Current p95/p99 corpus is derived from scenario-level medians with small-n operation groups; final high-confidence closure should include broader/raw-sample percentile evidence.
pending_blockers: Publish artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_highconf_v1.json and link final sign-off outcomes for full E5 closure.
Keep shared compile frontier stable enough for full baseline/auto/rollback reruns during high-confidence corpus generation.

decision_cards.summary: Block-Schur / low-rank accelerated elimination for hard decode systems.

expected_value.hypothesis: Reduce dense elimination wall time in hardest decode regimes.

proof_safety_constraints: Eligibility checks must prevent unsafe acceleration on unsupported matrices.
Conservative elimination path is mandatory and tested first.
Deterministic solver ordering must be preserved.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Only activate on explicitly matched hard-regime structures.
enable_controls: Runtime eligibility predicates with conservative fallback.

fallback_plan.trigger: Numerical instability signal, mismatch, or tail regression.
fallback_plan.action: Disable accelerated branch and force baseline elimination.

post_rollback_verification_checklist: Full deterministic E2E profile completes without acceleration branch.
Decode-success metrics remain at expected values for canonical scenarios.
Replay catalog entries remain reproducible.

deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_c5_hard_regime_activation -- --nocapture

decision_cards.summary: Deterministic peeling front-end with dense-core extraction.

expected_value.hypothesis: Reduce solver burden by shrinking dense core before elimination.

proof_safety_constraints: Peeling decisions must be deterministic and reproducible.
Unresolved cases must hand off to conservative dense-core solver.
No silent decode corruption permitted under partial peel outcomes.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Use deterministic peeling as pre-pass; escalate to conservative solver otherwise.

conservative_comparator.mode: direct conservative dense solve without peeling

fallback_plan.trigger: Peeling stalls or violates bounded progress criteria.

post_rollback_verification_checklist: Forensics profile emits deterministic logs and replay artifacts.
No peeling-specific branch taken in rollback mode.
Decode success parity with baseline retained.

deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_c6_dense_core_exercised -- --nocapture

decision_cards.summary: Runtime decoder policy engine with expected-loss strategy selection.

expected_value.hypothesis: Lower arithmetic work and tail latency by selecting strategies online under bounded rules.

proof_safety_constraints: Policy decisions must be deterministic for identical runtime state.
Fallback to static conservative strategy must always be available.
Policy logic cannot violate decode correctness invariants.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Enable policy engine with explicit caps and conservative comparator tracking.
enable_controls: Policy toggles and bounded decision thresholds.

fallback_plan.trigger: Policy-induced tail regression or unstable strategy flips.
fallback_plan.action: Force static baseline strategy and disable runtime policy adaptation.

rollback_rehearsal.command: rch exec -- cargo bench --bench raptorq_benchmark -- raptorq_e2e --sample-size 10 --warm-up-time 0.1 --measurement-time 0.1
post_rollback_verification_checklist: Strategy selection logs show static mode only.
Tail metrics compared against policy-on run are archived.
Conformance tests remain green.

deterministic_replay.pre_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_stable_workload_no_false_alarm -- --nocapture
deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_f5_policy_mode_recorded -- --nocapture

decision_cards.summary: Regime-shift detector with bounded runtime retuning.

expected_value.hypothesis: Adapt to workload drift while preserving deterministic fallback behavior.

proof_safety_constraints: No unbounded online learning.
Retuning updates must obey explicit caps and reversion rules.
Deterministic replay must produce identical retuning events for fixed seeds.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Enable bounded retuning under explicit caps and keep conservative rollback path immediately available.

evidence_refs: asupersync-j96j4 close_reason (2026-02-19): static-vs-retuned bounded detector implementation and validation

fallback_plan.trigger: Retuning oscillation, instability, or policy divergence.
fallback_plan.action: Disable retuning and force static policy engine behavior.

rollback_rehearsal.command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_stable_workload_no_false_alarm -- --nocapture
post_rollback_verification_checklist: Regime metrics remain bounded and deterministic on repeated runs.
No instability-triggered failures in conservative baseline replay.
Replay outputs remain deterministic across repeated seeds.

unit: rch exec -- cargo test --test raptorq_perf_invariants f6_ -- --nocapture
rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_f6_regime_tracked_across_decodes -- --nocapture

deterministic_replay.pre_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_stable_workload_no_false_alarm -- --nocapture
deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_f6_regime_tracked_across_decodes -- --nocapture

decision_cards.summary: Cross-block factor-cache + skeleton reuse for burst decode workloads.

expected_value.hypothesis: Lower p95/p99 latency by reusing validated elimination artifacts in repeating decode structures.

proof_safety_constraints: Reuse only on deterministic structural-equivalence checks.
Bounded cache policy with memory budget limits.
Fallback to conservative rebuild on mismatch.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Introduce cache in observe-only mode first, then gated reuse.

evidence_refs: asupersync-n5fk6 notes (2026-02-18): strict signature matching + bounded cache telemetry

fallback_plan.trigger: Equivalence mismatch, cache corruption suspicion, or memory pressure thresholds.
fallback_plan.action: Disable cache hit path and force conservative rebuild.

post_rollback_verification_checklist: Cache-hit count drops to zero in logs.
Decode correctness remains unchanged.
Latency comparator report archived.

unit: rch exec -- cargo test -p asupersync --lib raptorq::decoder::tests::dense_factor_ -- --nocapture
deterministic_e2e: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_f7_factor_cache_observed -- --nocapture

decision_cards.summary: Bounded wavefront decode pipeline with stage overlap.

expected_value.hypothesis: Reduce pipeline bubbles and improve burst-workload wall-time through bounded overlap.

proof_safety_constraints: Bounded queues with deterministic ordering.
Sequential conservative fallback remains first-class.
No stage overlap may bypass correctness guards.

adoption_wedge.strategy: Begin with conservative sequential baseline comparator and fixed queue bounds.

post_rollback_verification_checklist: No overlapped-stage events in structured logs.
Forensics scenario outcomes match expected decode success.
Replay command package generated.

deterministic_replay.post_change_command: rch exec -- cargo test --test ci_regression_gates g2_deterministic_replay_gate_verdicts -- --nocapture

closure_blockers: Complete final high-confidence offline comparator corpus for E5 (`asupersync-36m6p`) with p95/p99 and selected-profile vs scalar-conservative evidence links (rollback rehearsal outcomes are captured in `artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_bench_v1.json`; directional p95/p99 corpus exists in `artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_v1.json`; high-confidence run is in progress per coord msg #1487 targeting `artifacts/raptorq_track_e_gf256_p95p99_highconf_v1.json`, with transient compile-frontier remediation tracked in coord msgs #1493/#1504).
Promote F7 from proposed to approved_guarded only after burst-workload comparator evidence and rollback rehearsal outcomes are attached.
Keep F8 as template/proposed until implementation exists; then attach measured overlap-vs-sequential evidence and rollback rehearsal outcomes.
